Commentary: Imran Khalid to Roy, 1 run, fired in on leg, worked away to deep midwicket
Imran Khalid to McCullum, FOUR, that is not good bowling. Flat down leg, McCullum helps himself to four to backward square leg.

Imran Khalid to McCullum, FOUR, over mid-on. A tad too full, McCullum clears his front leg and powers one over the fielder. Very similar to the way he got out yesterday, but got underneath this enough
Imran Khalid to McCullum, no run, hammered back to the bowler
Imran Khalid to McCullum, SIX, flat down leg, McCullum goes back and slogs the ball waaay over midwicket. Those short boundaries again. Easy hitting
Imran Khalid to McCullum, FOUR, four more. 21 off the over. Backs away, gets a low full toss and crashes a drive through extra cover. Sedate start for Lahore
Mohammad Sami to Roy, no run, not a great delivery that. On a length down leg, Roy misses a whip. Struck on the bodt
Mohammad Sami to Roy, 1 run, runs down, works the ball into his body. One to cover
Mohammad Sami to McCullum, FOUR, advances again in typical style. Gets a low full toss and mis-times a lofted drive over mid-off. Four more.
Mohammad Sami to Roy, FOUR, full outside off, Roy mis-times his wild heave and the ball clears mid-off. Four more. Wanted to go over mid-on, but does it really matter?
Mohammad Sami to Roy, no run, worked away to midwicket

Mohammad Sami to Roy, FOUR, four more. Back of a length on off, Roy was looking at midwicket but the ball flies off the bat straight over the bowler. Looked at one point like it had gone straight up. But he had enough to clear the infield and almost hit the rope on the full. Bounced just inside though
Rumman Raees to McCullum, no run, beautiful slower ball. Flummoxed McCullum, too early into his shot

Rumman Raees to McCullum, 2 runs, just enough to clear mid-off. An excellent effort. Full delivery on off, McCullum mis-times his bunt. Sami runs after it and dives full-length but just can't get close enough.

Rumman Raees to McCullum, OUT, gone! McCullum picks out the fielder at deep square leg. A length delivery from Raees, McCullum swings but gets it off the toe end. Hangs in the air for a while, Billings is lurking at the square leg boundary and takes an easy catch. Key moment in the game. An over or two more of Baz and this game may have gone out of reach
Wicket: ['BB McCullum c Billings b Rumman Raees 25 (10b 4x4 1x6) SR: 250.00']

Commentary: Rumman Raees to Fakhar Zaman, 2 runs, nicely played. Overpitched from Raees on the pads, flicked away through midwicket for two
Rumman Raees to Fakhar Zaman, 1 run, driven up to mid-off for a run
Rumman Raees to Roy, no run, another well-disguised slower ball outside off, Roy is beaten on the outside edge
Mohammad Sami to Fakhar Zaman, no run, length outside off, played away towards point
Mohammad Sami to Fakhar Zaman, no run, fullish length outside off, Zaman swings and misses. Beaten on the outside edge. Some movement
Mohammad Sami to Fakhar Zaman, no run, on a length outside off, chopped away towards backward point
Mohammad Sami to Fakhar Zaman, 2 runs, not great batting. Play out a few dot balls and then attempt a big shot. Slower ball outside off, slapped over mid-on for a couple. Bad timing too
Mohammad Sami to Fakhar Zaman, no run, driven away towards extra cover from the crease

Mohammad Sami to Fakhar Zaman, OUT, one more. Zaman's stuttering, spluttering innings ends. A short delivery on middle and leg, Zaman wanted to pull but got nowhere near enough on his stroke. The ball lobs up off the splice towards short midwicket. Sami gets across and claims an easy catch
Rumman Raees to Roy, 1 run, full and straight, patted towards cover for a run. Good batting
Wicket: ['Fakhar Zaman c & b Mohammad Sami 5 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 62.50']

Commentary: Rumman Raees to Umar Akmal, no run, nice-looking stroke. Full and wide outside off, crisply timed to cover who parries to mid-off. Akmal's early dot-ball counter is at 1
Rumman Raees to Umar Akmal, no run, played away towards backward point. That's 2

Rumman Raees to Umar Akmal, 1 run, superb fielding from Asif. A thick outside edge from Akmal, races away to third man's left. He makes sure he is not in contact with the ball and the boundary at the same time while diving. Fantastic stuff
Rumman Raees to Roy, 1 run, worked away to deep backward square leg
Rumman Raees to Umar Akmal, no run, a wild swing and the ball beats bat. So that's three dot balls and one single from Akmal.
Watson to Roy, no run, 122 kph, pace off the ball. Length on middle, Roy is early through his pull and is beaten. Hit on the body, trickles by close to the stumps
Watson to Roy, no run, another slower ball, pulled away to short midwicket
Watson to Roy, 1 run, worked away to long-on, just one
Watson to Umar Akmal, no run, a short delivery outside off, beats Akmal on bounce. A cut is missed. Good bowling
Watson to Umar Akmal, 1 run, good single. Opens the face of the bat to get one to backward point
Watson to Roy, 1 run, a low full toss on off, pushed away to mid-off for a run. 50 off the Powerplay. The game in the balance?
Shadab Khan to Roy, 2 runs, some flight on off, shovelled away into the gap at midwicket for a couple. Nice flight
Shadab Khan to Roy, no run, Roy gets low to nail his reverse sweep to short third man. One of his most useful shots
Shadab Khan to Roy, 1 run, bunted away to deep midwicket for one
Shadab Khan to Umar Akmal, FOUR, short and wide this time from Shadab, Akmal goes back and cuts in front of point. Finds the gap, finds the boundary
Shadab Khan to Umar Akmal, no run, the googly on off, worked away to midwicket
Shadab Khan to Umar Akmal, FOUR, nicely driven away through cover, superlative timing. His initial call was two. Races away. Lovely stroke
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, no run, flat on middle and leg, Roy misses his flick. Struck on the body
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, no run, flat on the pads, Roy misses a flick. Another one that hits the pad
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, FOUR, looks for the reverse sweep. Fortuitous. Against Ajmal's extra revs, there is every chance of a leading edge. Gets one here but it clears and is wide of short third man
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, no run, flat on middle, Roy misses a sweep. Sliding down
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, 2 runs, worked away past midwicket for a couple, this is good batting from these two
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, 1 run, pushed through, flat and quick. Roy goes back and mis-times a drive to long-off. bad timing
Shadab Khan to Roy, 1 run, pushed through again, Roy sits back and slaps a cut to the sweeper cover
Shadab Khan to Umar Akmal, FOUR, that's tripe. Often happens with a legspinner. Quite a difficult art. Akmal gets down and nails a drive past cover
Shadab Khan to Umar Akmal, 1 run, driven away to deep cover
Shadab Khan to Roy, 1 run, worked away to deep midwicket
Shadab Khan to Umar Akmal, 1 run, flat down leg, nudged away for a run to fine leg
Shadab Khan to Roy, 2 runs, some more runs. Good fielding by Raees. Tossed up outside off, hammered past cover for a couple. The fielder at long-off dives to his left to save two
Saeed Ajmal to Umar Akmal, 1 run, played away towards point for one
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, FOUR, poor delivery. A slow delivery down leg, Roy gets low and times his sweep to deep backward square leg. Superb execution
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, 1 run, flat on middle, worked to midwicket
Saeed Ajmal to Umar Akmal, 1 run, nicely nudged to deep square leg for one
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, no run, a leading edge to midwicket. Looked to hit that through square leg. Ajmal bowling it slower now
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, 1 run, and quick this time, flat on off, pulled to deep square leg
Watson to Roy, 1 run, short delivery outside off, slapped away to long-on
Watson to Umar Akmal, SIX, nicely hit. Drops a tad short, Akmal stays in his crease and pulls over midwicket. Picked his spot and executed quite well
Watson to Umar Akmal, no run, full delivery outside off, chopped way towards cover
Watson to Umar Akmal, 1 run, another short delivery. Slightly outside off this time. A top edge to fine leg, on the bounce
Watson to Roy, no run, full and wide outside off, Roy toe-ends the ball to the keeper. Looked to go over cover
Watson to Roy, 1 run, worked away towards point for one

Saeed Ajmal to Roy, no run, flat delivery outside off, Roy misses his slog sweep. Haddin appeals after taking off the bails. The third umpire is called upon. Roy's bat is not down. His back foot is on the line, and that should be out. Is there something behind the crease? Doesn't look like it. Is there enough doubt for the batsman? Yes, says the umpire. Wow. That was out to my eyes.
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, 1 run, clipped away to square leg for a run
Saeed Ajmal to Umar Akmal, SIX, a tad short and Akmal rocks back to pull over midwicket. Read the length so quickly there. Went right back and generated enough power
Saeed Ajmal to Umar Akmal, no run, beaten on the outside edge. Slow through the air, this one drifts through
Saeed Ajmal to Umar Akmal, 1 run, nicely nudged to square leg for one. Clever batting
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, 1 run, flicked away to square leg to keep strike.
Rumman Raees to Roy, FOUR, superb start after the time-out. Gets a length delivery down leg and he pulls away merrily behind square for four
Rumman Raees to Roy, no run, length on middle, defended
Rumman Raees to Roy, no run, guided away towards backward point
Rumman Raees to Roy, no run, on a length around off, defended away towards backward point. So three dot balls and a boundary in four balls
Rumman Raees to Roy, 1 run, worked away into the leg side for a single
Rumman Raees to Umar Akmal, 1 run, guided away towards third man. Six off the over. Not a bad over for Lahore.
Mohammad Sami to Umar Akmal, no run, full delivery outside off, driven up to mid-off
Mohammad Sami to Umar Akmal, 1 run, short of a length outside off, slapped away to long-on for a run

Mohammad Sami to Roy, 1 run, what's the need of that? Some lackadaisical cricket from Roy. Gets across and scoops the ball on the bounce to a deep fine leg. Looks for the second but Akmal sends him back. Not good
Mohammad Sami to Umar Akmal, no run, superb delivery. Lovely take from Haddin. Bouncer on off, beats Akmal for pace, goes through. Haddin sticks out one hand and clings on
Mohammad Sami to Umar Akmal, 1 run, thwacked down to long-on for a run
Mohammad Sami to Roy, no run, full and wide, Roy backs away and misses the ball

Watson to Umar Akmal, OUT, straight to the man at deep midwicket. Back of a length on off, Akmal sits in his crease and pulls the ball straight down to deep midwicket. Wasn't short enough to pull in that direction. Islamabad still in this
Watson to Roy, 1 run, worked away down to fine leg, too straight
Watson to Elliott, no run, defended away down towards point. The fielder is quick to it, prevents one
Wicket: ['Umar Akmal c Billings b Watson 35 (26b 3x4 2x6) SR: 134.61']

Commentary: Watson to Elliott, 1 run, shortish delivery, Elliott shimmies down and pulls to deep square leg for a single
Watson to Roy, 1 run, on a length and straight, worked away to midwicket
Watson to Elliott, 2 runs, bunted away over cover. A length delivery outside off, Elliott stayed back and lofted that for a couple
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, no run, Roy runs down and works the ball to midwicket. No spin. Slid that one through
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, SIX, comes down and gets enough on that. Huuuuge. Got underneath the length and sent it to the second tier to get to his fifty.
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, 1 run, flat outside off, Roy stays back and pummels a flat-batted push to long-off

Saeed Ajmal to Elliott, OUT, still in it are Islamabad. Flat delivery outside off, Elliott sweeps but gets a top edge which is easily taken by deep backward square leg. Always a risk playing with a cross bat to Ajmal because of the number of revs he imparts.
Saeed Ajmal to Roy, 1 run, flicked away to deep square leg for a run
Saeed Ajmal to Narine, 1 run, pushed away towards point for a run. Nice and tight from Ajmal, nothing full, nothing short.
Watson to Narine, SIX, pulled and clears square leg. Narine doing his batting credentials no harm. A short delivery on middle, Narine sits back and whacks the ball over square leg. Shot
Wicket: ['GD Elliott c Asif Ali b Saeed Ajmal 3 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 75.00']

Commentary: Watson to Narine, no run, a bouncer on off, Narine is beaten trying to pull. Well bowled
Watson to Narine, FOUR, clears cover this time. Watson delivers this a little wide, allowing Narine the room to drive up and over. Nice timing. Decisive blows these
Watson to Narine, SIX, six more. On the pad, Narine stays in his crease and helps the ball over fine leg with a neat swipe. Enough on it. Aided by the bad line
Watson to Narine, 1 run, drilled down to long-off for a run
Watson to Roy, FOUR, another powerful muscular drive. Watson errs too full and Roy belts the ball back past mid-off for four. That should be the game too
Mohammad Sami to Narine, no run, excellent yorker from Sami outside off. Narine is beaten for pace.
Mohammad Sami to Narine, 1 leg bye, another yorker on middle and leg, off the pad towards gully
Mohammad Sami to Roy, 1 run, on a length on middle, pulled down to long-on. Clever stuff from Roy
Mohammad Sami to Narine, no run, strays down leg, did it brush the pad? Yes says the umpire. A legal delivery
Mohammad Sami to Narine, FOUR, looks for the yorker, misses and that is four. Narine muscles a drive past cover for another boundary
Mohammad Sami to Narine, no run, short of a length, worked away to midwicket
Rumman Raees to Roy, 1 run, bouncer on middle and leg, pulled away to fine leg

Rumman Raees to Narine, FOUR, that's the game. Narine's superb cameo seals the win. A tad short there was Raees on the pad, Narine stands tall and pulls in the gap behind square for four. A clinical chase. Islamabad were simply outplayed and outclassed in this game.
